metadata.title: CVE-2020-0432 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In skb_to_mamac of networking.c, there is a possible out of bounds writedue to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-143560807

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-96-generic - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-4.15.0-96-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-4.15.0-96-lowlatency - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-96-generic - 4.15.0-96.97
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-96-lowlatency - 4.15.0-96.97
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-96.97').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-46.38~18.04.1').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.59').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.69').
